header: Criminal Bail Application No. 15/2019 (CNR No. MHPU01­000021­2019) Ramkrushna Rakhmaji Bidgar and Anr. Vs. State of Maharashtra (Through Shirur P.S.)

background.text: ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 Applicants Ramkrushna Rakhmaji Bidgar and Vaibhav Dashrath Pandule have filed this application under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure for the grant of Anticipatory Bail in connection with C.R.No. 937/2018 under Section 323, 327, 143, 147, 149, 504, 506 of the Indian Penal Code.

under section 323, 327, 143, 147, 149, 504, 506 of the indian penal code

arguments.text: [2] Perused the application and say filed by I.O. I have heard both the sides and perused the material placed on the record.

argumentSentences.text: [2] Perused the application and say filed by I.O. I have heard both the sides and perused the material placed on the record.

arguments.text: [3] It is alleged by the complainant Lahanu Bidgar that on 07.12.2018 at about 06.00 p.m. the applicants no. 1 and 2 along with other co­accused came on the agriculture land of the complainant and started to destroy the water pipe line and pump starter with stones. The complainant and his son came at the spot of incident. At that time, all the accused abused and threatened the complainant. On these allegations, the applicants prosecuted.

argumentSentences.text: [3] It is alleged by the complainant Lahanu Bidgar that on 07.12.2018 at about 06.00 p.m. the applicants no. 1 and 2 along with other co­accused came on the agriculture land of the complainant and started to destroy the water pipe line and pump starter with stones.
The complainant and his son came at the spot of incident.
At that time, all the accused abused and threatened the complainant.
On these allegations, the applicants prosecuted.

arguments.text: [4] The Ld. Counsel for Applicants stated that, the applicants are innocent and have not committed any offence. Prior to this, the accused filed police complaint against the complainant. This complaint is nothing but a counter­blast to the complaint given by the applicants. The custodial interrogation of the applicants is not necessary. There is no specific role attributed against the applicants. The ingredients of Section 327 of IPC is not attracted at all. Hence, prayed that, the applicants be released on anticipatory bail.

argumentSentences.text: [4] The Ld. Counsel for Applicants stated that, the applicants are innocent and have not committed any offence.
Prior to this, the accused filed police complaint against the complainant.
This complaint is nothing but a counter­blast to the complaint given by the applicants.
The custodial interrogation of the applicants is not necessary.
There is no specific role attributed against the applicants.
The ingredients of Section 327 of IPC is not attracted at all.
Hence, prayed that, the applicants be released on anticipatory bail.

arguments.text: [5] Ld. APP for the State submitted that the I.O. want to seize the weapon used in the offence. The I.O. want to interrogate the applicants in detail about the incident. The custodial interrogation of the applicants is necessary for the purpose of fair investigation. Hence, prayed to reject the application.

argumentSentences.text: [5] Ld. APP for the State submitted that the I.O. want to seize the weapon used in the offence.
The I.O. want to interrogate the applicants in detail about the incident.
The custodial interrogation of the applicants is necessary for the purpose of fair investigation.
Hence, prayed to reject the application.

arguments.text: [6] After hearing both the sides, and perusing the material placed on record, it reveals that, the Applicants filed complaint against the informant and others before filing this complaint by the informant. There is dispute in between applicants and informant on account of pipeline of the agricultural field. All the alleged offences are triable by Court of Magistrate. There is no specific role of the alleged applicants in the alleged crime. Their custodial interrogation is not necessary. They are ready to abide the conditions imposed by the Court and to co­operate the investigating agency. Considering the facts and circumstances of the case, there is no hurdle to release the applicants on anticipatory bail. Hence, following order

argumentSentences.text: [6] After hearing both the sides, and perusing the material placed on record, it reveals that, the Applicants filed complaint against the informant and others before filing this complaint by the informant.
There is dispute in between applicants and informant on account of pipeline of the agricultural field.
All the alleged offences are triable by Court of Magistrate.
There is no specific role of the alleged applicants in the alleged crime.
Their custodial interrogation is not necessary.
They are ready to abide the conditions imposed by the Court and to co­operate the investigating agency.
Considering the facts and circumstances of the case, there is no hurdle to release the applicants on anticipatory bail.
Hence, following order

order.text: ORDER [1] Application (Exh.1) is allowed. [2] Ad­interim protection granted is hereby confirmed. [3] In the event of arrest of the applicants ­ Ramkrushna Rakhmaji Bidgar and Vaibhav Dashrath Pandule in the matter of C.R.No. 937/2018 under Section 323, 327, 143, 147, 149, 504, 506 of the Indian Penal Code registered at Shirur Police Station, Pune, they be released on their executing P.R. Bond of Rs.15,000/­ each and surety each of like amount on the same conditions. [4] The applicants shall co­operate the investigating agency, as and when required.

processedText:
Criminal Bail Application No. 15/2019 (CNR No. MHPU01­000021­2019) Ramkrushna Rakhmaji Bidgar and Anr. Vs. State of Maharashtra (Through Shirur P.S.) 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 Applicants Ramkrushna Rakhmaji Bidgar and Vaibhav Dashrath Pandule have filed this application under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure for the grant of Anticipatory Bail in connection with C.R.No. 937/2018 under Section 323, 327, 143, 147, 149, 504, 506 of the Indian Penal Code. 
---background-ends---
[2] Perused the application and say filed by I.O. I have heard both the sides and perused the material placed on the record. 
---argument-ends---
[3] It is alleged by the complainant Lahanu Bidgar that on 07.12.2018 at about 06.00 p.m. the applicants no. 1 and 2 along with other co­accused came on the agriculture land of the complainant and started to destroy the water pipe line and pump starter with stones. The complainant and his son came at the spot of incident. At that time, all the accused abused and threatened the complainant. On these allegations, the applicants prosecuted. 
---argument-ends---
[4] The Ld. Counsel for Applicants stated that, the applicants are innocent and have not committed any offence. Prior to this, the accused filed police complaint against the complainant. This complaint is nothing but a counter­blast to the complaint given by the applicants. The custodial interrogation of the applicants is not necessary. There is no specific role attributed against the applicants. The ingredients of Section 327 of IPC is not attracted at all. Hence, prayed that, the applicants be released on anticipatory bail. 
---argument-ends---
[5] Ld. APP for the State submitted that the I.O. want to seize the weapon used in the offence. The I.O. want to interrogate the applicants in detail about the incident. The custodial interrogation of the applicants is necessary for the purpose of fair investigation. Hence, prayed to reject the application. 
---argument-ends---
[6] After hearing both the sides, and perusing the material placed on record, it reveals that, the Applicants filed complaint against the informant and others before filing this complaint by the informant. There is dispute in between applicants and informant on account of pipeline of the agricultural field. All the alleged offences are triable by Court of Magistrate. There is no specific role of the alleged applicants in the alleged crime. Their custodial interrogation is not necessary. They are ready to abide the conditions imposed by the Court and to co­operate the investigating agency. Considering the facts and circumstances of the case, there is no hurdle to release the applicants on anticipatory bail. Hence, following order 
---argument-ends---
ORDER [1] Application (Exh.1) is allowed. [2] Ad­interim protection granted is hereby confirmed. [3] In the event of arrest of the applicants ­ Ramkrushna Rakhmaji Bidgar and Vaibhav Dashrath Pandule in the matter of C.R.No. 937/2018 under Section 323, 327, 143, 147, 149, 504, 506 of the Indian Penal Code registered at Shirur Police Station, Pune, they be released on their executing P.R. Bond of Rs.15,000/­ each and surety each of like amount on the same conditions. [4] The applicants shall co­operate the investigating agency, as and when required. 
---order-ends---
Sd/­ Pune ( G.P.Agrawal ) Date : 23/01/2019 Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. : 4 : CERTIFICATE I affirm that the contents of this P.D.F. file order are same word to word as per original order. Name of Steno : Smt. S.N.Kale­Steno­Grade­I. Name of Court : G.P.Agrawal Addl. Sessions Judge,Pune. Order delivered on : 23/01/2019 Order signed on : 23/01/2019 Order uploaded on : 24/01/2019
